decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bring them back into play with reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. Utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Brazen Borrower and Baleful Strix helps control the board while setting up the reanimation strategy.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and The One Ring to quickly overpower opponents. Cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury provide removal and disruption. Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void are key pieces in disrupting the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to lock opponents out of casting spells with color-specific requirements using cards like City of Traitors, Chrome Mox, and Lotus Petal to accelerate its game plan. Overall, the deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and control the game through aggressive plays and disruptive elements.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption, while also utilizing ramp cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to quickly cast powerful threats. Additionally, the deck has strong synergy with artifacts like Chrome Mox and The One Ring to further disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on using cheap and efficient threats to control the opponent's board while applying constant pressure. It also utilizes disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its threats. Delver of Secrets and Nethergoyf provide early aggression, while Murktide Regent offers a powerful late-game threat. The deck's mana denial plan is supported by cards like Wasteland and Daze, aiming to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo advantage. Additionally, Dauthi Voidwalker acts as a versatile tool for disrupting graveyard strategies.
